text: I've only eaten here once but i had a great experience. The sushi chef was friendly, knowledgable, and quick on making my orders. The fish was very fresh and delicious.

Since it was my first time trying Hokkaido, I decided to try the Hokkaido Symphony Land and Sea combination plate. It came with filet mignon, scallops, lobster, and vegetables. It was amazing! It's a bit expensive, but you get an a lot of excellent mix of high-quality beef and seafood. 

Chef Luong is very friendly and entertaining. He creates an awesome dining experience coupled with the delicious food he makes. The restaurant atmosphere is inviting and it shows that they thought about every piece of the design and its place.

I highly recommend checking it out. You won't be disappointed!

Sayonara Benihana! Welcome Hokkaido!

I originally made reservations at Osaka , but the reviews were terrible... so I researched and the reviews for Hokkaido were good...  and I must say they were ACCURATE!   This place was great.  Our chef was awesome and our waitress took great care of us and the food was great.  I don't eat meat but everyone else raved that the fillet was the best they had ever had.  The shrimp was by far the best I have ever had.  We had a few sushi rolls that were very good also.  Prices were within reason, no better and no worse than most other restaurants of this type.  We can't wait to go back.

11.10.2012 Hokkaido Teppanyaki Steakhouse (Las Vegas, NV)

Hokkaido Teppanyaki Steakhouse is a pretty long drive for us to go to dinner... but I do not care! I love this place. I love the customer service and the food is fantastic too! The waiters and staff are always checking to see if you need anything or to refill your drink. If you haven't been before it's a must try! Hokkaido Teppanyaki Steakhouse is a Japanese restaurant where they cook  your food in front of you. For dinner they start you off with a salad with ginger dressing and miso soup. I had the filet mignon and shrimp combo. They also give you steamed rice ( unless you request fried rice) and grilled vegetables. I also have the new 2013 Entertainment book, which had a coupon for up to $25 off our bill. So it was an awesome dinner for a reasonable price! However, I would go here regardless of if I had a coupon or not!

 

Impressed!

This has got to be one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas. The food is really good and the service is excellent. I always get the combination New York steak and shrimp with fried rice and vegetables... So good! The sushi is pretty good too, but I typically don't come here for the sushi.

I went here for Christmas dinner. There was only my mom, myself and my daughter in the entire restaraunt being we went here around 4 pm and on Christmas. I was very disappointed with the food. The chef was very nice although he marinated everything in garlic. All we tasted was garlic when we ate our food. I'm from the east coast and have been to plenty of great tasting hibachi. This was not one of them! Maybe the food would have been better if it weren't  overloaded with garlic. Maybe ask to go light on the garlic? I'm giving this place three stars because of the quality of food and great service.
Worst I've had. Absolutely no flavor and I left hungry. $3 extra for fried rice?? Never seen that before and hope to not see it again. I will not be back.

Good Teppanyaki.  Didn't blow me away.  But if you like teppanyaki, it's okay.  The kids like the show.   I think most teppanyaki are over priced.  Still trying to find one that does all the same stuff at more reasonable price.

Decent sushi and teppanyaki. The prices are a bit high for the quantity of food. The sushi rolls are miniature, had the spicy salmon and red rock rolls. I was surprisingly charged $2.50 for hot tea which is customarily a complimentary item at Japanese restaurants. Not a big fan overall.
Great place!  Been here a few times in the last year.  Always get great food and service.  Even our kids love it!  We've tried the sushi and teppanyaki-both are always fresh and tasty!

If I'm in a mood for sushi and don't want to travel a distance. This is the place, sushi chef Sam specialty is the poki salad. It's amazing and refreshing, all of the al carte  is fresh and Sam's spicy tuna is on point.  And their Tappan dishes is good.  But I'm there for their sushi.

This teppanyaki steakhouse was awesome! An unexpected gem. The Summerlin area is very quiet and family friendly - a welcome change from the strip. The atmosphere was very relaxing, pleasant and classy. The photos on website don't do it justice.  Our chef, Ronnie was very pleasant to talk with and cooked the food to perfection. The chefs here are not overly showy or flamboyant like a lot of other teppanyaki restaurants and I have to say it was a nice change. The waitstaff were great - quick to refill our glasses and remove dishes from the table. All in all a really nice evening out with our family. We'll be back again!

The food was good but I experienced another Teppanyaki few weeks ago which was cheaper and the rice was more elaborate than plain rice and we had more sauces options too. 
But the service is really good, they are nice and the food is still tasty.
Other things you need to know and which is good and bad : they have an amazing/fancy dessert with hand made chocolate but they have only 5 a day so we weren't able to try it and when we picked a dessert thinking it was the fancy one they didn't tell us it was not coming with the chocolate thing...

We just moved to Vegas from FL where we had fabulous hibatchi grills. I read all of the great reviews of this place and sorry fellow Yelpers, but you rated this place WRONG! It is quite nice for d√©cor but the food is horrible!  They put a mayonnaise sauce all over the shrimp and scallops, charge you for fried rice when their prices are already high and the sauces and soup were disgusting!  I asked for some teriyaki to try to give the food some flavor but it was basically watered down honey....yuck!  Sorry, I will keep searching.  This cannot be the best Japanese that the Summerlin area has to offer.
Jennifer runs the best teppanyaki Japanese restaurant in summerlin. We go there almost every week and their filet minion with chicken combo is delicious

This is my favorite sushi place in Summerlin. The restaurant is new, clean and got nice decor inside. We didn't try the teppanyaki. We just went for their sushi. The sushi rolls were delicious,fresh and look good. We order lychee creme brulee for me and tempura ice cream for my husband. And both desserts were delicious. There were different servers stopped by on our table to check us out and all of them were nice and we were satisfied on their service.

Really enjoyed the Sea Bass that was prepared on the grill in front of me. The food felt good for me and tasted good (not overly rich, I guess.) Hostess, waitress and chef were all friendly. I'll be going again.

We were looking for sushi near our house. I had seen Hokkaido Restaurant in the past and we decided to try it.  The Teppanyaki area was very busy, and it looked delicious.  Since we wanted sushi, we sat at a table. There was only one person at the sushi bar.  The table had overhead lights, but really needed candles on table to see the menu.  We had to use the light from our phones. We ordered a mixed tempura appetizer. In the dim light we started to eat it and my husband said "this is greasy". When we were almost finished we saw a puddle of oil on the bottom of the plate! We told the waiter and he offered us another. We declined. We ordered three orders of nigiri sushi, a caterpillar roll and an order of salmon sashimi. The pieces of fish were really small. Even the rice was small. The roll was small too. But the worst was the sashimi. It came on a bed of ice in a margarita glass. There were supposed to be 4 slices, but there were small bits.  Our bill came to over $50.  If you are looking for decent sushi, don't go here.  I won't criticize the teppanyaki, as it looked good and the chef was doing a good job. They should fire the sushi chef.  We won't be going back!

Took family to Hokkaido since the teppanyaki place we used to frequent went out of business.  VERY pleasantly surprised!!  The food was great, the staff was very friendly, and the cooking show was new and exciting.  Definitely have found our new place to go for teppan.  Can't wait to take the kids since our son absolutely loves to watch this cooking.  Would definitely recommend this to anyone around town as a great place to eat and have fun.  Take your friends when they come to town.

Only complaint, I need to leave room for dessert since I am a creme brulee junkie and I'm dying to try the Lychee Creme Brulee next time I'm there!

The prices are very reasonable. But there's a reason for it. The sushi lacks, oh what is it, flavor?? I was caught off guard as when I came in I was welcomed with the awesome aroma of the teppanyaki.

I'm a big sushi fan and was disappointed with the quality.  It might have been an off day and I'll have to go back and try but I ordered tuna, salmon and yellowtail.

Nice venue.  Great location.  Hopefully the next time will be better.

We are new to Las Vegas, and we were looking for a Japanese Steakhouse that was similar to Sakuras (East Coast) chain.  Our kids love the entertainment from the chef's.

Well 1st of all, the food was excellent and the staff was very friendly.  2nd, they lack the humor from our other experiences with Sakuras. The chef didn't even do the "Fire Thing" for the kids.

3rd, even though the food was excellent, it was way over priced, paying for extras like "Fried Rice" was a little ridiculous. ...we wont be returning to Hokkaido for dinner.

I was visiting my family in Las Vegas and they had read the reviews on Hokkaido so we decided it would be fun.  Many teppanyaki's seem the same...the show is good...the food is okay...pay your bill and go.  Hokkaido was truly great.  Our chef had some new tricks I hadn't seen before and the food was REALLY good, we were all surprised!  All service was great, and the decor was very pretty and modern.  I would recommend this to anyone.

My husband and I are new to the area and still trying to find some great new favorite restaurants. So we decided to try a Teppanyaki, we loved the atmosphere and our chef matt was too too funny. We ordered the sirloin steak and shrimp and the chicken and shrimp, both were very tasty. But I do have to mention that the steak was half the size we would normally get at other Teppanyaki and the mustard sauce was quite heavy on the mustard, we are used to a lighter mustard sauce.  

Although I'm not sure this will be one of favorites, but would it work in a pinch. 

However, we are still searching for the one.
We were waiting for over an hour on Valentine's day! The fried rice wasn't completed and the steak was drowned with soy sauce.   The worst habachi ever! Pls people dont go overthere.
Wonderful family owned dining. Always a pleasure and fantastic experience. Jennifer is truly amazing.

Love this place their teppanyaki is very good,great service and there is always coupons in the mail!
Close to home nice locals hangout

Celebrated my birthday there over the holidays.  The waitress was friendly and  the service was fast and excellent.  The chef was entertaining, my 3 kids had a blast watching the chef prepare our food.  The food was excellent and our waitress even brought out a ice cream scoop w/a candle on top..will definetly be back next year to celebrate.

Had a $20-off coupon, so I thought we would give this a whirl. Standard hibachi fare, with the welcome addition of my favorite fish, which they billed as "butter cod." The food was fine, but the fried rice was surprisingly a bit bland. Loved the seafood sauce, and our chef was fun and personable. Not the best I've had, but you can never go wrong with hibachi!

We love hibachi and have been wanting to try this place out. Overall it was a good experience. Service is very friendly. The ginger salad is very light and refreshing. The fried rice is one of the best I've had. Food is average and a bit overpriced. If you are not into mayo based sauces (my husband gags at the thought of mayo) be aware that the seafood is drenched in it. Service beats any other hibachi place in town....but you will pay for it. $80 plus tip for two people.  We didn't order alcohol and ordered one dessert.

Fun place. The cook was so nice and put on a nice little show for us. Food was superb. It's a little pricey, even with the coupon I had. Will come here for an occasional treat with the family. Nice area and right by my house. Glad to have it in my neighborhood.

It was very good! Went for my daughters bday, practically every table at the Teppanyaki grill was celebrating something! Our chef Rodney was very friendly! They bring out huge sparkler dessert for the birthday guest! I would go back!

Ate here last week and just getting around to reviewing. This place is fantastic! We have eaten here several times and have never had a bad experience. We had Roni as our cook. He is very pleasant and a incredible cook. Had the filet and lobster and he cooked it to perfection. Wife had scallops and shrimp. Hers was also cooked perfectly. Do not hesitate to try this place. You will not be disappointed-I promise!!!
Love this place so much! Ask for Chef Aaron he is the best and definitely entertaining. Great ambiance and good for groups or even just a night out. They always give exceptional service

Went to dinner 3/2013 with three of us, it was entertaining and very delicious it was so good I could eat there every day . We had the salad, soup, shrimp, chicken, scallopes, tempura and it was all cooked to perfection. Prices were perfect for the food received not too pricey. My 3 year old son loved the entertainment . The service for the wait staff lacked a bit but the chef made up for that ten fold
Food was amazing! Service was great and as a frequent customer of Benihana I would say the habachi chefs were better, food tasted better and the prices were better! I will definitely come back!

This is a very nice location and a good-looking restaurant. I enjoyed being spoiled with reservations at this hibachi/teppanyaki restaurant. 

Our server was enjoyable during the preparation. He made jokes, juggled knives, and tossed shrimp into patron's mouths that willingly took on the challenge.

All of the food was tasty. I ordered the filet and lobster, which came with fried rice, two shrimp, and miso soup. Everything was prepared as expected. The meal was enjoyable.

Two downsides: First, the water softener they use does a self-cleaning of the line once a day. Apparently, the wait staff doesn't know when that will happen on a daily basis - strange. So, it happened prior to our meal. My water was cloudy and my iced tea tasted like salty dishwater. The waitress acted like this was no big deal. Secondly, the meal overall is rather pricey for what you get. Honestly, I could go to a Brazilian steakhouse and have five times the amount of choice meats in an amazing atmosphere for the same price. This means that I must come to teppanyaki for the entertainment while eating. Yeah, that's it. Unfortunately, that makes this restaurant a once a year adventure.
Some of the best Teppanyaki I have had in town.  Nice atmosphere.  Try the lychee creme brulee for dessert.

Hands down the best Teppanyaki house in the 702!!!! I've been going here weekly for years and the quality of food has never wavered. The staff is awesome as well. Highly recommend for little kids, date nights, big gatherings, or whatever

For starters, Soft shell crab, spicy tuna and Gyoza.  Fried rice,  New York steak, and Chicken all cooked on a hibachi grill by the talented Daniel son. 

Fresh food, great taste and you are able to share portions..overall good experience. I shall return...

Hokkaido Teppanyaki Steak House is a really good restaurant in Summerlin. I like the location because its not on the strip or a very busy street, and is close to my home. 

I've been to quite a few Teppanyaki restaurants, however, this one stands out immediately due to the beautiful design. It has a Modern Japanese vibe to the interior. The atmosphere is  upscale but fun, and family friendly. The service is polite and attentive as it should be. The chef's are fun, entertaining and highly skilled.  

This is an excellent addition to the restaurant scene  in my neighborhood, and it's great not having to go to the strip for a notable time out.

The Good: 
- This the tastiest Teppanyaki that I've ever had.  They season their meats really well and the rice is my absolute favorite. 
- Prices are on-par with this type for restaurant.

The Bad:
- Soup and salad are blah (who goes for the soup and salad though??)
- There's always a long wait - don't even bother making a "reservation" because you won't get seated until 20-30 minutes later anyway.
Had the New York steak entr√©e. Both the meat and vegetables were salty. So we're the two dipping sauces.

It's like every other Teppanyaki place you go to. Prices start over $20 per dish. The servings are very small. I had the shrimp and my husband had the butter cod. For the price we paid we were not full. It came with miso soup and a small side salad. You go there more for the entertainment of the cook but you go home hungry. We felt rush. I would say we sat and ate for 45 minutes because busboys kept pulling our plates. They wanted to turn tables but when we walked out there was only 1 family waiting for a table. Does not come with dessert. But I see they have this huge cotton candy display if your order that and they have sparklers to light up your birthday treat. So if you are more for being entertained then this is the place to go. Ask for Ronny to be your grillmaster.

We have come here the last 7 years for Father's Day.  We are always seated right away and the staff has always been attentive to our order.  The food is very good prepared on the flat top which has given our family a great experience.

Went on Valentines day. Big mistake, place was so overbooked our waitress was ready to cry. Also, felt like a high school re-union, nothing but teenagers.
Food was good but drink service was slow.

Four for dinner.  Hibachi.  Went for 7pm on a Monday - not crowded at all.  Chef was fun - not over the top like some.  But in general, I'd do without the whole show.  It's definitely a "touristy" thing to see or something for young kids - I find it very silly.  Noticed two other chefs cooking and did not put on any show - one, flat out looked tired and didn't want to be there.  Either make them all animated or none. 
Waiter was very nice and friendly and always kept our glasses full - water and diet soda.
Soup and salad were good.  Got the filet mignon and chicken combo.  Very small amount of filet.  Veggies were just okay - lots of onions vs. some sprouts and zucchini.  Not a good ratio.  Ordered fried rice - was good.  I've had better.  Prices are expected.

Excellent food and service, far superior to Benihana.  My favorite is Land and Sea with lobster, filet, scallops, fried rice, soup, salad and desssrt.  Great sake choices from Japan for only 20 a bootle.  Kids love food and chef entertainment.  Jennifer and her family are great owners and hosts.

The best! The fillet is one of the best fillets ever and I recommend that you request with Matt! He is the best, always satisfies us! Kids love him and his show! The owners are very nice, and great service. You will also love the house salad with ginger dressing. Oh and perfect deserts! Enjoy, we always do!

Overall really like this place and will definitely go back.  We had a table of 5 and everyone thought the food and overall experience was delicious.

-----

GOOD
Food
Food quality and presentation for both sushi and teppanyaki was really nice.  Steak cooked perfectly.  Fried rice was awesome.  Mexican roll nice sized portion and fresh.  Very tasty Lobster and Scallops.

Atmosphere
Very nice atmosphere.

Clean
Staff was cleaning tables and grills at all times.

Bus Service
Water and drinks kept full.  Empty plates removed promptly. 

-----

NEEDS WORK
Waiter/Host
Was not familiar with the menu gave bad information.  Was "slow" in that he seemed like he just walked out of Bill and Ted's Excellent Adventure.

Portions
Ordered the steak and scallops and only got 4 medium sized scallops and a unusually small portion of steak.  For the price it was really off.

Upcharge
Hidden $3 bucks to upcharge to fried rice for teppanyaki.  Really?  This is customary and should be included or disclosed at the very minimum

-----

Despite the problems the food and experience was still good.  Combined with the convenient location we'll be back a second time.

Went to dinner with our daughter, son-in-law and our grandkids. We were seated right away without reservations on a Saturday evening which was amazing. Beautiful restaurant and we had a great Teppanyaki Chef. He was super friendly and accommodating to our needs and especially the kids.
The restaurant was busy but not overly so.
Food was prepared right in front of us with the typical Teppanyaki flair. We had Scallops, Shrimp, Steak and Chicken and it was all delicious.
Make sure you add the fried rice and ask for their special spicy sauce and their home spun cotton candy for the kids.
All in all an A+ experience.
We will be back.

Wow, it was amazing!! The chef was very funny,nice and entertaining! The food is also very tasty!! It has lots of flavor and aroma!! I highly recommend the shrimp and/or fried rice! Plus they have tons drinks! The fire ball is rum that's on FIRE!! they ice cream is also very tasty! Overall it is clean and well-organized! I give five stars!
Freshest hibachi in Vegas! Will not go anywhere else now! Great service. Such good food. Ahhh
Food is always good and the staff is friendly. The chef makes sure the kids have a good time.

This place is a blast! Our chef was funny, the couple seated next to us were a pleasure to chat with, and the service was super attentive.

The ambience is classy and romantic, and this is a great place to go for a celebration or date night.

The portions are huge, though! I would recommend splitting an entree with someone (which they are more than happy to do) and then ordering a sushi roll or appetizer to share, too!

We love it!!!  We have kids and they love this place and the chefs are amazing. Very kid friendly and the food is delicious. My kids pick for their birthday dinners every year for the past 2 years and even my wife picked it for hers this year. We will be long time customers - i hope it does not go anywhere.

We love the sushi, atmosphere, staff, and above all the Sushi Chef.
Excellent selection, good price and delicious and fresh sushi.
Best Sushi we've had yet in Summerlin.

Delicious! Family owned-always a plus! I've been here a few times and the service is great! Everyone is very friendly! The food is delicious!!!! Great sushi and the hibachi is fantastic!!!! The prices are very fair!!! Definitely recommend this place! Casual but can make fur a fun night out!
First time their food was good priced well Chef was awesome like the scenery most definitely will return again for seconds

Our favorite Teppan restaurant! Extremely friendly staff, excellent food, and so far off the strip we don't have to worry about obnoxious tourists. We come here several times a month and never tire of the experience.
The sushi is great here and so is the service. I order the sashimi both yellowtail and garlic tuna and I ordered the Mexican roll. This place is good for hibachi as well.

It was easy to make a reservation unlike other hibachi places in town. As we walked in, we we're greated and seated right away. From there the service was awesome. Our chef was personable and made sure we were happy as was the rest of the staff. The food was good and the portions we're fair for the price, which is fairly comparable to similar venues. The one thing that stood out to me was the kindness of the female hostess on staff. Her energy was amazing and I feel like she's the type of person that makes it hard to be mad around her. She was awesome and made the end of our dinner awesome.

I love teppanyaki but it's not something my husband I do often since he's a picky eater. I had the NY Steak, which was cooked exactly as I asked: medium. Jeremy got chicken without all of the sides. After seeing his rather pathetic little pile of chicken compared with my steak, veggies, rice AND two shrimp, I hoped they wouldn't charge for the full chicken meal, since he also passed on the soup and salad. I was pleasantly surprised to see the bill where they only charged the chicken as an extra side. The waiter was also great at recommending a sake. It's something neither of us had ever tried and what we had was ok. He didn't automatically offer the most expensive selection, which I appreciated. I say the sake we actually had was only ok because I think it's an acquired taste. All of the food was delicious. Our chef was great with all the cheesy jokes and he seemed to really enjoy his work, which makes all the difference. Overall, can't wait to bring my parents here next time they visit. I think they'd enjoy it too. The sushi will be tried next time as well. All of it looked so good.

Love! They are always so accommodating and cater to everyone's individual needs. Awesome options for vegans and also will add less oil if requested. It's always a fun experience and the food is always delicious!!!!(:

Ordered Sea Bass and got Halibut! They are either unaware of the difference or they are deliberately defrauding the customers, they just said Sea Bass is the only fish they offer, like that would convince me. I've been eating Sea Bass for years and Sea bass has large flakes and is really soft in texture not firm and stringy like Halibut. And it should have a slightly sweet aftertaste and not taste 'fishy' at all, wasn't even a great piece of Halibut. I'm beginning to think PF Changs in the only place to get consistently good Sea Bass at a reasonable price. I feel bad for the Chef, not his fault, and he made a great flaming onion volcano.

Only go to this restaurant if:

1. If you have alot of PATIENCE and don't mind waiting 15 minutes to order and another 20 minutes for a chef to start cooking.
2. If you are on a DIET and want to spend a lot of money on a small portion of good tasting food.
3. If you don't really mind if you get drink refills, and don't mind sitting for 10 minutes with your mouth on fire.
4. If you want to pay for fried rice that you did not realize was an extra $3.80 because "it comes with eggs and some vegetables"
5. If you don't mind paying 20% gratuity for a party over 8, but are told that it is only an automatic 18% for large parties.

My husband spent 12 years in the restaurant business and always comes to the defense of a server because he is empathetic of the challenges of the position, AND this was the rare occasion that he asked to speak to management. He was very disappointed with his portion of the filet mignon and scallops. The filet was smaller than half of your palm and he received a measly 3 scallops. The worst thing was the amount of vegetables which normally are used to fill up the plate but could have been placed in the same sized small bowl that we received our $4 fried rice in. We were sharing the filet and scallops and added a rice thinking that was an additional portion, but a small bowl was the only portion we received....except for the spoonful of rice that was left over and placed on my husband's plate which was barely accompanied by a child sized portion of vegetables. I'm sorry but when you are paying $35 for a meal....you expect your plate to be at least half full. I told my husband to say something but since it was my birthday he didn't want to make a scene. He did however ask to speak to the waitress when we were charged for food we didn't order. We informed her of the error and she at first tried to argue with us, and then said she would just take it off and "take it out of her pay". She returned with a new bill but instead of taking off 3 extra fried rice, she took off 2. We again said that we only ordered one and she said again "she would just pay for it". While waiting for our 2 corrected bill, we discovered that we not only paid 20% instead of 18% gratuity, but when she made the adjustment to the bill the gratuity never changed. At this point we asked the bus boy to speak to management, and to our dismay who comes out....the waitress. We asked the waitress to speak to management and she said she WAS the manager! She asked what the problem was and my husband began to tell her about the portion sizes and not even receiving the jasmine rice that was supposed to come with our $35 meal and then how the gratuity was never adjusted at which point she cut him off and said she would give it back to us (because at this point he just went ahead and paid). She continued to cut him off and kept smiling at him in which he said it doesn't seem like you even care. Her response "I'm keeping a smile so I don't upset you" At this point we were so disgusted we left.

The owner has very talented chefs who were very entertaining but needs to improve:
-drink service
-portion sizes
-more servers
-better management

I would highly recommend you NOT waste your hard earned money to leave irritated, frustrated and still hungry.

Hokkaido offers a culinary experience of art cookery. A delicious and savory meal is prepared in front of you in a large teppan(iron) grill. Generally these are not tricky recipes but clever combinations of tastes that can be easily grilled in one go. Small bits of meat, chopped vegetables, noodles and eggs are some of the most common types of teppanyaki.

The staff was friendly and informative. We managed to dodge the dinner rush and experienced a menu with ample options. I highly recommend this establishment.

Believe it or not this is my first time trying hibachi/teppanyaki style dining. I always thought it would provide bland food amidst an entertaining show. Unsurprisingly, some of it was bland, but the fried rice, shrimp and the experience were awesome!

Teppanyaki Entree for 2: New York Steak & Shrimp, side salad, fried rice & vegetables $28.99 - This meal was prepared table-side with an intimate hibachi show for my fianc√© and ME. Starting off with a knife act, dramatic flames, onion volcano, onion choo choo train (so cute!), egg crack trick, fried rice heart (sweet), and a few other entertaining chef skills. Our shy chef was pretty quiet the entire show and didn't talk too much, but he warmed up to us and by the end of the night we were laughing about the scene from Beverly Hills Ninja when Chris Farley was a Hibachi Chef in the movie. So good! And too funny!

https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=y8klYPnHhCU

Now, let's talk about the teppanyaki! 
* The Egg Fried Rice was really tasty! We asked for extra garlic and I loved the crispy bits of garlic and crunchy rice texture from the grill. Flavor rating: 4/5
* The New York steak was cooked exactly how we requested it (rare) - it had nice flavor but it's not extraordinary. Just a solid steak if you're in the mood. Flavor rating: 3/5 
* The Vegetables: squash, mushrooms, and bean sprouts added nice texture to the meal. Flavor rating: 3/5 
* The Shrimp was so good! It's cooked in a creamy sauce with amazing flavor and it's super succulent! I would order all shrimp if I can next time! Flavor rating: 5/5

We also ordered some appetizers and a sushi roll from the sushi menu:
* Miso Soup - it was mediocre. I've had better miso soup in my day. Flavor rating: 2/5
* Baked Mussels $5.50 - the mussels were not saucy and too dry for my liking. Flavor rating: 2/5
* Soft Shell Crab $7.50 - the crab was breaded perfectly with a light panko breading and fried just right, extremely flavorful and crispy. Flavor rating: 5/5
* Sweet Heart Roll $11.99 - shrimp tempura, cucumber, spicy crab, eel, avocado. An extremely simple roll, but it's tasty. Flavor rating: 3/5

We had a great experience with top notch service. I would definitely recommend coming by specifically for a teppanyaki entree and a fun hibachi show!
We're been here a few times. Fairly consistent but I've noticed flavors do vary depending on which chef you get. Service is standard and food quality is good.

Came here with a large group, and the experience was very good! The Service was good, no delays, and they were able to do separate checks without any issues. Pretty impressive! Our chef was cool, but I did not get his name, unfortunately. 

I had the Filet Mignon and Chicken dinner. All of the ingredients were good quality. The filet was cooked a nice medium rare, as requested, but the chicken seemed a tad overcooked. The shrimp was delicious! The ginger sauce was good, but the mustard sauce went with the steak better than I thought it would. The chef also made me a spicy sauce, which wasn't bad. All of the food was good, but not the best teppanyaki I've had. I wouldn't have any issues coming back, but I'd like to try a couple of the other local teppanyaki places first.
Fun and Fresh Teppanyaki experience and Warm welcoming in the Neighborhood .

If I can leave a negative star I would. First off 7 months ago I was here with my lady and it was actually a great time we had here. Now .. oh man... now is just a complete different story. I don't know if they got new owners or new staff or whatever it is? But man do you guys need to hire on some people to help run the business better. Walked in and there were two whole grills full already being cooked for while the whole front was full of guests waiting. We came in and saw a family of 6 already waiting who knows how long? But as I got there another family of 5 came in 15 mins after me than another 4 people on top of that. We all waited up front  for about 20 mins before anyone came out to greet us and seat us. 



My lady doesn't like the whole show thing cuz she' hates being in the spot and shrimp thrown at her and all but loves the Teppan food . We sat down and waited as two servers and the owner walking by us over and over and over again. So I started to try and get eye contact with one and they kept ignoring us. To a point were I was about to get up and leave. Finally after 13 mins of sitting there with no service our server came up and apologized and took our order.we were at a table across from the grill not the actual teppan grill table .Ordered one sushi roll and a teppan plate of filet and shrimp with double orders of fried rice. First off the sushi bar had NO ONE there at all. The sushi chef was looking up at the TV watching the basketball game the whole time. Cool he had no orders that's not a problem. But once we had our order places I couldn't help but to notice the sushi chef watching tv and still not making our roll. Finally after 10 mins I see him making it.. 10 mins pass and he's still not done? We waited and waited and we saw our teppan guy started cooking our order. I over heard him saying it was for us so I knew. He cooked our whole plate in literally 6 mins. So we got our plate and still no sushi yet !? As we start to eat our fried rice came out a few mins after our plate was done and I knew that our rice was not cooked on the teppan grill and was cooked in the kitchen in a wok. You can tell the nasty greasy soggy difference in between it. I was so pissed off! How can you half ass an order and only cook the meats and veggies on gone grill and have the kitchen cook the fires rice? How sad is that? The fried rice was the nastiest fried rice I've ever had in my life! I took 2 bites and it was soggy bland and just gross! Both my lady and I hated it! Half way through our meal 20 mins later finally our sushi comes out. And damn ... disappointed again.. we got a deep fried phile roll and we always do any and everywhere and you can't go wrong with it pretty much. This one was probably the worst sushi roll I've had in my life. The rice was so full of vinegar and also soggy !! The roll was super small and barley had any salmon in it. It was full of cream cheese and soggy salty rice! We than told the server about the rice cuz we hate to complain and we're the last to try and bully people into getting free food. But I just had to. I'm not gonna pay for some nasty food I didn't even eat . I told our server about the rice and after coming back right away with no arguments nothing at all he said they took the rice off our bill cuz they knew we knew the rice was cooked inside the kitchen. Anyways we still paid a 60 dollar  tab for a small piece of filet and some veggies and 5 shrimp and a soggy sushi phile roll. Never coming back again. This was all going on while there was the place packing up and people waiting and waiting for food and service while only two chefs were there and two servers running Around like chickens with their heads cut off. Stay away from this place ! If you want real service and real food and want to have a nice Japanese teppanyaki experience gonto every other place here in Vegas but this one. They like to be cheap with their ingredients and the quality of all of it is just pure trash. If your gonna use trash to cook with your gonna get trash in results. And hire some staff! You need the help stop being so cheap!

Absolutely worst manager and host team in the business. Came in for Mother's Day with a 7:00 reservation and did not get sat til 7:42, with somewhere to be after. When we checked in, the host seemed confused and the manager started shouting out "anyone party of 2, 4" and people without reservations just start walking in. Myself and another guest questioned the host, he seemed confused and said oh sorry we will get you soon. We then talked to the manager and she said "we busy" and did not want to listen or hear that we had reservations or other places to be. Finally, she sat us at a table sat for 3, after telling her we had 4 in our party several times. Food was excellent and the chef tried apologizing for the service and was also struggling to get help from his server assistants for basic items like more plates, sauce trays, etc. At the end of the meal we were given cotton candy as a gesture of goodwill. We don't eat cotton candy and instead would have rather had our mom from out of town have an on time reservation or transparency up front letting us know they were behind and it would be X minutes.  In addition, they were so over capacity they were pulling up additional sushi tables to the main grill tables.  Hard to walk around, you could tell servers were confused at basic service help since the seat numbering was off. There are many other Teppanyaki grill restaurants in town.

I love this place!

The hostess is adorable and she always remembers me. Everyone is really friendly, therefore great service.

Food is yummy. I've had the teppanyaki style and I've also just sat at the sushi bar. One of the sushi chefs let me sample different sauces he was trying out, so that was kinda neat.

They are better than Benihana's, but I wish they had the onion soup.

It is a little pricey, but it's normal for teppanyaki. Overall this place is guaranteed to deliver good food and a great time.

I was so glad to have tried this place for dinner last night. My girlfriend had suggested Hokkaido being she is a regular there and I was pleasantly surprised.
It is a newer restaurant, very clean with a more modern decor. The service was excellent. The waitress never let our glasses get empty.

Of course we went on an off night and it was a little slower but I was really surprised that they would have the chef come out and cook every time customer's came in instead of herding people and making them wait to fill up the teppan table.
Even if there was just a couple, they would get seated and the chef would come out soon after drinks were provided and orders were taken!

The Teppan Chef prepared the food cooked to perfection. We both had the filet and shrimp and they truly were cooked properly.

The only small issue I had was that everything was sauced so it did make for a very salty dinner but next time I can ask for no sauce during cooking so that I can use the dipping ones instead. Even the fried rice had too much soy sauce in it but otherwise the meal was great.

I especially liked that we had the buy one get one free from Entertainment Books website so it made dinner all the more worthwhile.

I would definitely come back and highly recommend this local teppan restaurant to everyone!
It was a great experience, food was delicious....The chef was awesome, the decor was very modern, will definitely go back!

Very tasty. A bit pricey but you are paying for the experience. There are a few spots better in LA n SD so i cannot compare the spot to any other vegas spot since i haven't been anywhere else there. We did have to wait a while for our chef guy to show up  he was friendly but not as enthusiastic as i would like. He was a kinder older man with Miyagi qualities.  I'd go again but wasn't super impressed. 3.5

I hadn't been to a hibatchi place like this since the Clinton Administration was in office. But the Entertainment Book had a very good coupon, so the Mrs. & I gave it a whirl on our date night.

It was rather empty on a week night so we got special attention. Our chef wasn't Japanese (or Asian at all) but he spoke with that accent, which was funny. A lot of the jokes were kinda dated but I felt like I had to laugh at them just to be a good sport. His knife skills were pretty good. You can tell the rookies by how they just slap the utensils around aimlessly without purpose. But our chef did well, including building the classic onion volcano and the wall of fire.

My wife had the chicken. I had the scallops and calamari. They were both surprisingly yummy, mainly due to the sauces that came with the plates. Portion sizes were reasonable (I remember always leaving hungry after Benihanas). My wife and I were entertained by the cheesiness of it all. I just wished there were new tricks and new jokes to go with the updated food.

Nice atmosphere. Service is good and food was good. There is a lot of space and enough parking. The only thing was you are gambling on the type of chef you get; either entertaining or not entertaining.... we had a party of 7 and we got "not entertaining". Would still go again if I were in town.

Thanks to @hokkaidolv for a fantastic dinner out, my first in a long long time. Everything was wonderful and delicious. Their take on sushi, from the excellently cooked unagi to the salmon with a piece of lemon on top, was majestic. Your sushi chef is truly amazing. All of the communal grill stations with happy laughing families was definitely a plus, not to mention the  fireball desert that was an obvious home run with the children there. Great job.

 *edit note - -changed unami to unagi. Yes, I'm pretty dumb. :)

Omg this place was so good, I did a to go order because my baby was sleepy and my order was perfect and my filet mignon was so perfect. I can't even explain how good my food was, the shrimp, vegetables, rice, everything!!!  My sons almost 6 and his first time ever liking steak, soooooo good. We'll plan on eating here very often

I love this place! My family and I love going here when we run out of ideas for dinner or for a nice date night. My only grip is that it's not open during lunch because it would be so easy to sneak in here for lunch!

2nd time frequenting this establishment. Took the youngster for his bday. They treated us great, the food tasty, and the bill well...my kids ordered like we were the damn Kardashians. So anyways, this is a cute quaint spot to go on a date. I will be back.

Just left: This restaurant is fabulous. The delicious food,  atmosphere, and warm service.  We drive 25 miles to eat here! 
   Tonight, the Filet Mignon was a perfect cut, and whatever sauce they put on the shrimp, brought out the YUM! Loved the Lychee Sake and not your typical fried ice cream: the ice cream was covered with pound cake before the Panko then fried.

Quality Teppanyaki. Chef has skills and does the typical game (catch an egg in mouth, shrimp in hat, knife juggling, etc.). The food wasn't the cheapest at about $16 for veggie chicken, $23 for meat, and $35 for higher end dishes. Also have combos add about $5 each. The restaurant is small but very nice with 8 hibachis and a few free standing tables and bar for sushi or a la carte ordering. They also have a small but useful alcohol menu good for anyone to find something worthwhile to drink. In the end, our meal for 2 was $90. This is very expensive in my mind for this type of cuisines and a night out in lower Summerlin, but no complaints with the food or drink or service quality.
Sushi was excellent.  Came for lunch and want to go back for dinner for Teppanyaki.

They had great chopsticks. I'm a sucker for quality chopsticks. Drives me nuts when you get some cheap pair at a supposedly nice restaurant and you have to rub them together so you don't get a splinter in your mouth.

Aside from that, the food was average. It was good, but average. The steak was chewy, even though I had it done medium. I had to remove a lot of gristle. The fried rice was good, they were very accommodating and substituted oil for me instead of using butter. And they were really pleasant about it, and the service was friendly.

I'll come here again, but I'll just get the veggie tepp instead.

Amazing service everytime I visit. Sam is the man behind the sushi bar. Ronny has mad Tepanyaki  skills and is entertaining. I brought some friends from out of town and we all enjoyed. On a following visit I was asked about how my friends were. It's the little things. The food is excellent and fairly priced. My go to when I want some good Tepanyaki and sushi.

The food was fair. But I ordered the lobster and scallops for $40 something and got a very very small serving of lobster. Given that we took 9 people out to dinner and the bill was $500, I would not go again.
Celebrated my parents 60th wedding anniversary last night. Food was delicious. Chef was entertaining!

This place is within walking distance of our home in summerlin.  Loved to drop in for a quick sushi roll with husband or a friend. Kids loved the chefs cooking in front of them of course.  We like the red rock roll, Mexican roll, spicy tuna , California crunch,dragon,007,tiger,screaming o.  Of course we always order more than we can eat lol.
Off the strip so it's not a pricy as the ones in the hotels. Very good food and show. You can get dressed up but it not that fancy.

everything was fine, except for the cook.  he was extremely awkward.  he wanted to talk about transvestite movies, and books about sex zombies that he writes.  i came here to meet my sister's husband for the first time, and i was who recommended this place to them.  awkward.  an extremely cringeworthy experience to complement my first impression on my new brother in law.
I am very picky when it comes to fish and this place is just ok.  Maybe it's great for their cooked food, but for someone who appreciates fish, I would skip this place.

Our first date night in ages away from the children.  Nothing like food flying and not at you for a change.  The cook was very entertaining, the service incredibly attentive.  It was both romantic and fun!

The atmosphere is okay and the food is high quality but Matt is the reason I keep coming back to this place.. he's the best chef around. 
Do not get anybody but him. HE'S THE BEST. Plus he has a great personality, very funny and very entertaining.

My boyfriend and I come in here on a regular basis (maybe 2-3 times a month) and the staff are always very friendly and efficient. It's pretty quiet during the week and I've never had to wait for a seat when it's been a small group of us (2-4 people). The chefs always have a great sense of humor and put on a good show. I usually order the filet and scallop combo and the chicken and shrimp is good too. My parents were visiting from England last week and they loved it! We'll be back for sure!

Steak not sushi. If you want sushi eat at the bar where they can see you, or get take out. Better, go elsewhere it you want sushi. The staff is overworked and there is no one to greet you or seat you.  Once seated there is no one to clean the table. At night the non-teppanyaki tables are dark and ignored. We had basically no service. No water refills, no clearing of plates, and forever to get any food at all. The title says steak for a reason. And plan to take a shower when you get home - we came for sushi and our clothes and hair were filled with the teppanyaki smell when we left.

Fantastic food. Try the sparkling blueberry sake. It's worth $16 for a bottle. I highly recommend coming here and getting the steak and chicken combo. And definitely get the fried rice. I come here often and will continue to.

Recommend this place for sushi and hibachi. 

I wish they had some sort of happy hour but It's totally worth reaching in the wallet for!!

I like Hokkaido crunch rolls as well as the tiger

They have a cotton candy tower for dessert

Zero complaints!! We go at least twice a month. Never disappointed. Yum yum sauce is very yummy. Staff is awesome.
Remembers what we order . Friendly, fast and quality of food is amazing. I recommend this place to many of friends and even strangers. I will never go back to Benihana's! 

Eat at the sushi bar. Same guy every time, he is awesome.

My husband and I were in the mood for sushi the other night so we decided to check this place out. We sat at the sushi bar and ordered edamame and a few rolls. Everything was excellent! The staff was very friendly, especially the sushi chef. Prices were reasonable too, which I was shocked about since it's in Summerlin. Will be back!!
Great time as always..celebrated or daughters pre k graduation...reason for not a 5 star...im not a fan of cooked lobster going back into the raw lobster Shell

The food was excellent.  I appreciate that, even though we ordered our beef cooked differently, the chef worked the grill to cook the well done meat in a hotter part of the grill so that everyone was still served together. Very nice. We had the Filet Mignon and didn't order any sushi. I wouldn't have had room anyway.  I strongly suggest paying the small price to add fried rice. It was delicious. We also had a nice conversation with the chef. He didn't stay locked into the flipping shrimp show, but showed enough that we knew it was there for the asking.  Only complaint - wait until we're done to bring out the mop bucket.  We'll be back though. The price was better than most Teppanyaki places and the food didn't disappoint.
We have a place back in MO that is our favorite but this is a close second and the staff is extremely nice! Well done!!! Nom nom nom

Came in for the hibachi, Great atmosphere and food here. What I really love is that you get realistic portions here unlike other hibachi's they barely give you any for your plate. The seafood is yummy although I do wish they had the thicker style noodles. Price is reasonable. Would definitely come back to try the sushi.

Went here the other night to start my date night with the wife and it was amazing! Great service and very entertaining. Staff was very friendly and the food was amazing. Wife got the shrimp and chicken and I got the filet mignon and the chicken and it was amazing! Highly recommend to anyone who loves hibachi!

Had to give this place 5 stars because our cook was so enthusiastic and hilarious. He referenced Japanese sauces, techniques and tools to American things like happy meals and zambonis. 

Waitress was super nice too. 

Get the lobster! So worth it. 
Mustard sauce was weak. 

Great for families too but just me and my boy went.
I ordered sushi and a glass of wine. Delicious wine. Okay sushi, not spectacular. Very fresh but not very flavorful. I am happy I tried it but probably won't be back.

Love this place! Have been here 4+ times and will continue to come back.   I always get the filet & scallops hibachi - So great. I love the seafood sauce on the shrimp and scallops - very tasty (I mix it with the rice too). The fried rice is tasty and fresh.

My husband and I do not like the soup and instead we ask for 2 salads, which they always glady do for it. I love the salad, the dressing is great. 

Price wise I feel it is very reasonable for what you get, and considering you get your food cooked in front of you.  We just went and got:

Me:  Scallops hibachi plus fried rice
Him: Filet and shrimp plus fried rice
2 diet cokes (no alc. bevs) 

and the total of check was $64.

Also this place is way better than Bennihanna at the LVH. Benihanna was awful, the atmosphere is drab (everyone packed into a tight room with ugly green walls), and the food was not as tasty, I like Hokkaido's food better)- plus Hokkaido is cheaper.
Amazing experience! The quality of the food is top notch. I will definitely be back and bringing all of my family and friends soon. Thank you Jennifer ! Exceptional service !!
Best food this side of Japan and priced very reasonable! Service was 5 Stars . Noguchi you are the best! Will return again. Much Aloha from Hawaii, Tadao T

Besides the fact we were rushed to order after barely having time to look over the menu the first time we went and some not so friendly servers, everything else was good. The food was AMAZING, sooooooo flavorful and cooked to perfection. The chef was super friendly, funny and entertaining. We went with the lobster, steak and some shrimp, everything was seasoned perfect! A bit expensive but worth the indulgence!
This place is great!! The guy cooking the food was hilarious! I had the filet mignon and lobster and it tasted great! I would love to come back here again!

Brought my honey and some friends from out of town to this place.  Had a 20% off total bill coupon from Entertainment Book so thought what the heck, let's go.  Glad we did.  It was a fun time.  Our teppanyaki chef, Matt was a funny guy and made us laugh.  The food was fresh and delish.  The restaurant was quiet and not too full so we almost had the place to ourselves.  Our friends had the fried ice cream for dessert and I was a tad jealous, it looked really tasty.  Had a great time, loved the decor.  Will go back again.

We came to Hokkaido after we couldn't get a table at Ohjah.  It was refreshing to be seated right away because I was starving! It may sound shallow but that's one of the reasons why I like Summerlin there are like 3 hibachi places in close proximity.

Our chef was fun ...he was more fun after we gave him a couple shots of sake..LOL The food was awesome! Everything was done like a typical habachi show. The difference that I liked was on the shrimp he put what resembled Mayo and Siracha . It was tasty! I also had some flavored sake but was willing to try this children's soda they have there. It looked intriguing on how you open it. I think you have to push a metal ball down the top in order to open it. I know you must think I'm easily intrigued...I am sometimes.

We had the tempura ice cream to finish our meal. It was a wonderful ending to a fulfilling meal! The atmosphere isn't as rowdy as some hibachi places. It's a nice relaxing time where you don't have to yell to carry on a conversation.

One of the better Teppanyaki places in Las Vegas.
Key point of Teppanyaki is the fried rice! If the rice is bad..... forget it.... you can't recover. Hokkaido's fried rice was good.... so lets continue.......

Good service, good location. 
Started off with a nice cold sake (always the best way to start teppanyaki)
Then a really nice spice to the edamame... good and hot!!! Ooooooo Yeah!
Salad was crisp and fresh and a good ginger dressing. Miso soup was good quality.
Entree: Shrimp was very good. Lobster was even better!!!!
Super tender, juicy, seasoned with butter and garlic, and their dipping sauce has a little extra touch of flavor which was a nice treat.

Lets get back to the fried rice...... the key reason to return to a teppanyaki restaurant is the fried rice, there is nothing like fried rice cooked on a teppanyaki grill.... this one is worthy of returning.

Came here for dinner on our last night in Las Vegas with family and friends on 11/30/14.

Place is small.  The sushi is great.  Would definitely come here again for the sushi.  Hibachi isn't bad.  Portions are a bit small than other hibachi places, which is fine.  They also upcharge for fried rice, while at other hibachi's comes with it.  They don't serve noodles with your meal which is also fine.  Service was good.  Wasn't crowded at all when we went.

We went to this Teppan Steakhouse because it had some of the best reviews on Yelp.  We also chose Teppan because my 81 year old mother in law had never been to one.  We wanted to show her the Japanese flair cooking of singing twirling spatulas and flying eggs and of course the onion volcano.  
Unfortunately I think we got the DISHWASHER as our CHEF at our table.  All the other tables were filled with oooohs and ahhhhs of the chef's tricks, but our lame "cook" did NONE of the traditional fun.  He basically cooked the food in normal fashion like I would at home.  Why pay the extra money for this?  
He didn't make enough rice to even fill the bowls, he sliced and cooked the steaks one at a time and his "special flavoring" was a TABLESPOON of GARLIC per small steak.   Luckily I saw this before he got to mine and asked him to hold the garlic.  Who wants to hide the flavor of a good filet mignon with a huge dollop of garlic? 
His onion volcano was a pitiful 2 layers of onion rings. and he left the vegetables for last and cooked them so little time, they were firm and practically RAW on the plate. Cold raw cabbage in the mix? blech!
I gave 3 stars, because despite the pitiful skills, the soup, rice and steak did have good flavor.  the vegetables were fresh and would have been good if properly cooked.  If you get a good chef, i'm sure this would be an excellent restaurant.  we were just unlucky.
Hokkaido manager, I hope you read this and make sure to properly train the chefs before you put them on the floor.  NOT a fun dinner by any means.

I went there last week and it was not Good like previous times I been there before. So we went on a Wednesday night and I asked the waiter about their sushi menu. I have never had their sushi..... I ask about the shrimp Tempura roll he kind of explained it to me, I then asked for a menu to see what I wanted.... I couldn't make a decision so at this time they bring out our soup and salad appetizers which my soup was lukewarm and my son's and husband's were boiling hot..... No problem I switched with my son. Our salads came out and when I say I had three pieces of lettuce and a half bowl of ginger sauce.... Believe me so I ask the waiter in a joking serious way soooo you guys cut back on the salad he said oh yeah it's just an appetizer...... Oh okay but my meal is $28.00..... Then look what arrived a shrimp tempura roll I DID NOT ORDER that yet... I told him I didn't order this he looked at me like well he made it... I look at the sushi bar and the guy was staring at me so I kept it. I told him next time I will send it back.... My husband kept saying send it back if you don't want it. The chef was a nice guy and cooked the food so-so he seem like he couldn't wait to get off so he could hit the club...hey we live in Las Vegas....... I don't think I will be back any time soon I was very disappointed... There quality really went down... I had liked them wayyy over the Benihana here in town....

Came here on a friday night for my friend's bday. Place was pretty busy luckily we have reservations. Parking lot was also pretty full. Food is good everything seems pretty fresh. I ordered scallops and filet mignon. Scallops melts in your mouth. I was not a fan of the filet mignon too chewy and flavor wasn't there. Service was excellent. I am disappointed on why you need to pay extra for fried rice? What the heck shouldn't it be included? The portion size of the fried rice is also teeny tiny. Like they're putting you on a diet. Seriously. You get 2 pcs. of shrimp and a side of veggies which includes onions, zucchini, sprouts and mushrooms. I think I got 5 pcs of scallops and also like a handful of the filet mignon. I don't eat a lot but even for me the portion size is so tiny and not worth the 30+ dollars they charge plus you have to pay extra for the fried rice which is so stupid and you only get a little barely a full cup.

My favorite Teppanyaki and sushi restaurant in Las Vegas. The owners are some of the nicest people I've ever met. The food is delicious and the chef's put on a good show. Great place to bring the family!

GOOD
Our group of 6 (2 kids 4 Adults) wanted tepanyaki and we thought it would be good entertainment for the kids while the adults drank...ha! 
No way we were driving to the strip for tepanyaki...so glad we didn't.  Who knew this great place was in the neighborhood and at really reasonable prices for portions and quality.

I would definitely suggest the steak entree.  The combos were good but just seemed like more bang for your buck with the single entree  orders.  (See menu pics)

The chef was great (see pic) sorry didn't remember his name...too much sake. He was entertaining the kids and actually carrying on a conversation with us.  Fried rice was bomb..everybody was happy with seasoning and sauces with the whole meal. There was two other tables with kids...so definitely family friendly.

The service was great and staffing was perfect.  =) There's a bar in the dining area but very small...its not the type you'd wanna hang out at and eat dinner by....just saying.

BAD
The lighting in the restaurant was fine when we walked in cause the two other tables were in full service (745pm).  As they cleared the different tables and grills...they shut off the lights and ambiance gets very gloomy and too dark.  Hence the 4 stars instead of 5 stars. Ambiance killer.

I definitely would dine here again with family or friends.  Prices are good and so is the service. 

OH! I almost forgot the cotton candy was a hit! ...i usually stay away from that type of sweet stuff but it was good =) and the kids loved it!

This place can be easily missed as its in a tiny strip mall.. We drove by and decided to check it out. I was hesitant once we entered and found the place nearly empty on a Sunday evening. Sure, it's nice to not have to wait for a table, but why is nobody else here?? You can sit at the sushi bar or the big tables for teppanyaki. We opted for the entertainment, so we sat at the big table. The staff was very attentive, maybe too much.. There was a man and woman waiting on us in tandem and they clearly didn't communicate. No biggie.. Our chef was super entertaining! All the same old tricks we've seen at other places, but still fun..catching things in his hat, volcano smoke out of the onion, etc.. I oered scallops and filet. I asked for my filet to be rare plus, it was more like medium :-( why is everyone afraid to leave the meat a tad bloody? Other than that, everything was pretty decent. Sushi I fresh and delish. We ordered noodles, which was almost $5 extra!! And I was disappointed when everyone received rice but me..not sure why..

My family and I have literally been coming to Hokkaido since they opened when I was in high school. World class hibachi, flavorful food and most important of all, excellent service! Jennifer, the manager, always greets guests with a friendly smile and has treated as well since Day 1. Chef's recipes are fantastic and the menu has a diverse selection of combinations. To top it off the ambiance is great and a well designed restaurant. A true family establishment that prides itself on service and utilizing quality ingredients. They also have sushi and table dinning if you're not in the mood for Hibachi. We will be back again and again. Thank you Chef, Jennifer and all the other team members of Hokkaido!

Great food and service !! Romantic sitting quite environment.. every staff member is amazing  and best customer service... delicious food and drinks  reasonably priced... we had a great time 
Thank you !!!!

Great food and open dining, every time I get a chance to go here I take my family, it's one of the best steak houses that also has a park right across the street from it. I enjoy all the food here so it would be tough to pick one
The teppanyaki was amazing...our chef was very entertaining and the prices werent that bad. The staff was very friendly and accomodating to our needs. No complaints here.....

I use the Buy One Get One coupon from the Entertainment Book, which brings this down to an affordable treat.  I've never been "wow"ed by the chefs -- pretty standard performances ... but the food is better seasoned than Benihana.  I adore the shrimp.  Portions are probably right, but I end up finishing every last morsel off my plate and often wish there were more! ;-)

Are you looking for a great family time out or a magical date night? Then you have struck gold! Hokkaido is all that and more, I have been multiple times to this restaurant and every time we ask for Chef Matt! His mixture of Dad jokes and amazing cooking makes for a great night for family's and dates. Enjoy just a great time and make sure you put in a reservation.

I've never been a fan of the whole teppanyaki experience.  Growing up in San Francisco, I used to watch the tourists enjoy the theatrics at the famous Benihana restaurant in Japantown.

It all looked like fried rice to me and I always wondered how the food got properly divided when you have multiple parties at your table.

After watching a teppanyaki competition on the Food Network, I realized there was a bit more to just cooking on a propane-heated flat surface grill.

First off, it helped that the Husband and I had the teppanyaki chef all to ourselves.  Sure, it's not likely you'll get that experience, but it definitely contributes to a good or bad evening.  Chefs with a good personality will give a good show and everyone will have a good time.

I chose the Chicken and Scallop Combination Dinner ($24.95), while the Husband chose the New York Steak and Chicken Combination Dinner ($26.95).  They both came with miso soup, ginger salad, steam rice, shrimp and seasoned vegetables.  

The waitress was a smart one - she offered edamame to start when she got our beverage orders.  And suggested the fried rice option when we put our food orders in.  We declined and she offered one order so we could share it.  For $2.95 more, we upgraded one of our steamed rices to a fried rice.

When it came down to it, our chef was entertaining and engaging.  He did a few tricks that we didn't see during the competition, and that had us a bit surprised.  He was friendly and personable, and it did make for an enjoyable eating experience.

Food-wise, we were both pretty full surprisingly.  Was it worth the $50?  Not really.  (It helped that we had a BOGO free entree with the Entertainment card.)  It was definitely something to experience at least once.

Not only do they have teppanyaki tables, but regular tables and a small sushi bar.  Most diners were enjoying the teppanyaki experience here though.

We used to come here quite often, but have been going to another Teppanyaki grill closer to our house.  We had a coupon...so....
First, let me say that the staff is usually pleasant.  Last night the waiter was pushy in getting is to place our order.  I know that the other people at the table were seated first, and already eating their salads, but if you are in a rush to start cooking for the table, seat us elsewhere.  We ordered a Philly roll, which was "adequate".  As my husband said, it looked like a roll you could buy in a food store.
We both ordered fried noodles instead of rice.  Each was an additional $4.95.  Are you serious?  Basically it's thin noodles with garlic and sauce.  Most of the Japanese stead houses charge extra, but that's ridiculous.  And I noticed that when the chef was making the fried rice ($2.95 extra, I think) for the other guests the amount of vegetables, etc. that were added had decreased from the last time we were there.
My husband had the filet and scallops and I had the scallops.  First word that comes to mind is "greasy".  Everything was too oily and over-seasoned.  My husband felt that the steak was not the quality that it used to be.  The scallops had a good taste, but were greasy.  
The chef seemed to be going through the motions (beating heart of rice, onion volcano).  Maybe we're just so used to the show, but nothing special there.
I also ordered a glass of plum wine.  The cost was $6.95.  Wouldn't complain, but the glass was less than 1/2 full -- not an "honest" pour.
There are several places in the valley that are of higher quality and at a better price.
We won't be back.

I ordered pick up craving for a spicy tuna roll. Ordered ultimate tuna, scallop mix with zucchini with miso, fried rice, cucumber salad, sashimi yellow tail. All delicious I would have given 5 stars it was the wait time took additional 15 mins overall food was good.

This was a great find. Staff was friendly and attentive, food was excellent. Jason was an entertaining and fun cook to prepare our table side dinner. We had 2 five year olds who enjoyed the whole experience. Memorable evening for my parents wedding anniversary.

Its located across from Garden Park in the newish Summerlin Area.  The place is very clean and high-end Asian-Chic (if there was such a thing). Wait staff was friendly and well mannered.  It wasn't super busy around 7pm when we arrived, but it most reached a full house by 8pm.

Our teppanyaki chef Matt was very entertaining; he's got lots of cheesy food jokes but seemed to really enjoy what he was doing, which made the experience that much better! The food was great.  We had steak, shrimp, chicken, scallop, veggies as well as the fried rice.  Everything was up to par and satisfying.

We also ordered the Chef Special Hokkaido Scallop Sushi roll.  The reason why we ordered it was because it's a sushi roll with banana in it, which is an ingredient we've never seen in sushi before...the end result was W.O.W!  Its a chunk of sweet banana on top of a tender scallop, both wrapped with soy-paper, and the whole thing was flash fried, then topped with surimi and some yummy orange color aioli.  The representation of the dish was pleasing to the eye, and the taste reminds me of tempura fried banana, almost dessert like! The combination was almost surreal, leave me wanting more!

For dessert we ordered Lychee Creme Brulee.  It was also ordered out of curiosity.  We didn't think Lychee would pair well with creamy eggy things...guess we were wrong!  The Lychee flavor was definitely a big part of the creme brulee.  In a way, it lightened the heaviness of the dessert.  On the bottom of we also found chunks of lychee, which was an added bonus to the dish!

We left the place with full stomach and big smile.  Goodtimes!
Awesome!!! Ask for Aaron for a chef, lots of good energy, very entertaining!  Modern Decore very clean, comfortable atmosphere feels right at home!  This will be our new favorite spot for hibachi!

Went for a Christmas Dinner with the whole family last night (12) and all had to squish into just one side of the teppan table.  This is a Chinese owned Japanese restaurant, did not know that before entering.  Wonder how you'd feel going to a Japanese owned Chinese restaurant or an Italian owned French restaurant, anyways.....  

The service was okay, nothing to YELP about.  I think the prices are definitely high, ordered the combo meal, NY steak and Shrimp, got what seems like a 4oz. piece of steak and two shrimps for something like $24 that included a tiny salad with some veggies and a bowl of fried rice, totally not worth the price when there was hardly any flavoring in the food besides a little butter and soy sauce.  

They first serve the fried rice and veggies, probably wanted you to fill up on rice and veggies before they serve the meat and seafood.  Asked why the steak was so small compared to others that did not order the combo but just steak alone. Was told the combo steak is smaller because it was a combo meal.  Do not get this since the combo meal is more expensive to compensate for more food but that was not the case.

Our average per person including 3 kids was about $25 each for food excluding tips for the cook and wait staff.  Was still hungry when we left.   

Though the service was okay and the chef was somewhat entertaining for kids, it was not at all worth the price they charge.

Great service! 
had an awesome time Teppanyaki Style (: I will definitely be back! food was delicious, a bit pricey but it was worth it.
We love this place but I think they don't have any air conditioning we are miserable tonight. Awesome food but you can't enjoy it

This place was great. Not only the food, but the chef was also very friendly and funny.

It's your typical hibachi style restaurant with typical menu items, and a few desserts. The tables seat 8, I went with just my mom and we sat next to a really nice family visiting from California. The ambience encourages you to interact with your table mates and there is a TV, but it's off in the distance and is not a distraction.

The missing star is only because it's a bit pricy and the portions aren't very large. They also never served me my rice that was supposed to come with my meal. 

Random advice: the restaurant is small and the hibachi tables are close together, which means it's HOT in there. Not so much so that I was uncomfortable, but it's definitely not your typical AC on full blast Vegas restaurant.

I will be back.

I have never encountered such a boring tepanyaki chef and I mean BORING. He didn't even pop the shrimp in everyone's mouth and did no tricks. I think the only thing he did was light the onion on fire and then once the smoke was out he blew the whistle to sounds like a choo choo train which made no sense because there was no smoke coming out of it. Food was good but way overpriced. Sticking with Ohjah.

PROS: food
CONS: the chef and pricey

Teppanyaki, tableside grilling with shrimp flying in the air and big flames heating the large griddle in front of the patrons is fun, but not authentic Japanese cuisine. Rocky Aoki:s restaurants in Tokyo are called Benihana of New York. But it's still entertainment and kids love the blazing knives and food flying in the air. Hokkaido does a good job, but Musashi is more authentic in cuisine and flavors. No one can speak Japanese here. Green tea is awful. Service is very good.

Always a favorite for the missus and I! Been coming here for nearly 6years and never a poor performance! 
Food always cooked to perfection and the staff are on point! Pity about the grumpy twats who don't opt for a private table. They just mess with the vibe.
Otherwise, love this place!!

Great service and delicious food.  The sushi is mediocre, but the teppan grill is the way to go here!  Although our chef initially did not do the fun tricks, when we asked him, he delivered. We enjoyed the filet, shrimp, chicken and vegetables.  This is the perfect neighborhood Teppanyaki House!

The first experience I had at Hokkaido was fabulous.  The amazing food with large portions kept us coming back.  We loved it so much our wedding rehearsal dinner was held there.  Here is where my compliments stop.  4 guests of our party of 40 got FOOD POISONING.  They were all seated at the same table, which made me believe a portion of the food was spoiled.  One of my bridesmaids was so weak and sick she barely made it to the wedding.  When telling Hokkaido about this they made the situation right (as much as they could) by reimbursing the portion of food at one table. My last experience, that pushed me to write this review was tonights dinner.  We ordered a variety of teppanyaki of chicken, steak, shrimp and scallops.  The steak well past a medium and as tough as leather, scallops as thin as a pancakes ( I believe they cut them in half),  and portions half the size as what they used to be.  When I finally complained about the quality of food the manager told me they were cutting costs and scallops are very expensive.  WHAT?!? We just paid $50 for this!  I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND EATING HERE TO ANYONE unless you want to risk food poisoning and get well below average food.
Still love this place after all these years. Consistently good food. Still my favorite teppanyaki joint. Yum!

Excellent all the way around. Our party of four had fish, chicken and beef, requesting varying doneness. We were astonished that every piece of it was cooked perfectly, tender and moist, juicy and full of flavor. Of course the show when you order teppan style was great as expected.  Clearly the owners of this establishment provide their chefs with quality ingredients. We will definitely be back!!

Service was great!!  Food was good too!!  Ordered the California Crunch roll....Mixed Tempura as appetizers to share---was yummy!!  For dinner I had NY Steak and Scallops...other half had just steak and my son had childs Teri chicken.  All dinners come with salad, miso soup
and rice (fried optional for 2.95).  Meals range from 20-40.00....but quality is there!!  Overall I was very satisfied and will return!  3 check ins and you get a free roll...!  Yum!

Honestly I'd give it a 3.5 if I were given the option. The interior design is really nice and reminiscent of a casino restaurant in terms of coolness factor. Our waitress was attentive and did a good job taking care of us.
Our teppanyaki chef really tried hard but somehow just fell short. His skills operating his cooking utensils and doing any type of "tricks" that you normally associate with his position were lacking. He also had way too many one liners and seemed to try too hard cracking jokes rather than focusing on a teppanyaki chef's cooking & entertainment skills that are done with his hands & utensils.
All in all the food was good but not out of this world. My wife had the scallops dinner and it was made very well, definitely recommended. I had the steak dinner and it was done quite good as well but no big surprises either way. Where they fell short is the fact that the veggies were sorely lacking in quantity and I've never had cabbage instead of sprouts... and it's not for me. Along with upcharging $3 a piece for fried rice is a bit on the steep side in my opinion. Walking away I still felt hungry so we headed to Waffles for dessert and I suggest you do too! :)

What a great experience! The entertainment of our hibachi chef was wonderful! He kept the mood light & the food was delicious! Wasn't too crowded & very easy to get reservations. They're only open for dinner so keep that in mind. We will absolutely be back!

Love love love this place! Any special occasion or date night when you can justify spending a few extra bucks, it is so worth it. The food is consistently delicious, and the presentation never disappoints. 

The fried rice is essential it is so good! I always love the chicken and shrimp, but others have feasted on the beef and scallops which are each a high quality meal. If you can use a coupon, such as the Entertainment book, you can get a free or discounted meal. Well worth the purchase of the book. 

I highly recommend this local Summerlin favorite!! Enjoy.

I was in from out of town with my family and wanted to try some new places while in town. Heard about Hakkaido from some friends.
