My family has never tried this type of food and thought it would be fun for them. Great food and experience for everyone. The cook was funny and creative and made the kids laugh. I couldn't be happier about the food and service and the owners were awesome coming out and saying hello to our table. Will be goin again when we come into town. The steak was so good and tasty and the kids really enjoyed the fried rice. I don't think u can go wrong with anything on the menu.

This place is amazing! I came here to celebrate my birthday with my family and it's some of the best food I've ever had. We did the surf and turf option which came with lobster, filet mignon, and scallops. The filet was cooked so perfectly that it was melt in your mouth even reheated! The chef was a lot of fun and really good at his job. The meal also comes with salad, fried rice, miso soup and dessert or sake. They do give you a free ice cream dessert for your birthday and it has a firecracker in it! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone! And I would suggest making reservations just to be on the safe side.

Food is delicious here. I'm from Utah and the food and service is 100 times better than what we get at home. Got the filet mignon and shrimp. The meat was very tender and shrimp had very good flavor. Highly recommend coming here to eat.
awesome food. pull up. you'd love it, everything is delicious. steak & shrimp plate is amazing and the sake too
Scallops w chicken. Came with a soup and salad. Drink was a apple pear saki other than the sauces being a tad runny. Not bad. I did expect more scallops for the price.

From the moment I first stepped in the door of this restaurant that it was going to be amazing.  The smells in the air made my mouth instantly water.   It can be a little busy but the service is truly remarkable!.  We were seated immediately and our drink order was taken right away.  Shortly after our drinks arrived and our food order was taken, the chef came out.  This is such a fun, interactive experience that I would love to do over and over again.  I ordered the chicken and my friend ordered a steak and chicken.  There was also another family at the table with us that ordered chicken, steak, lobster and shallots.  It's was amazing to watch the chef make everything from fried rice to stir fry veggies to meat right on front of us.  All the staff was very frien6and accommodating.  It can be an expensive dinner but it is definitely worth the price you pay.  I will be back her again, that's for sure!

Second time here in less than a week. Jennifer remembered what we wanted and ordered immediately- wow- 
So, filet and chicken were delicious, the land n sea is mouth watering. Sashimi was fresh and the presentation in a glass was very impressive. Daughter loved her steak so we all were very satisfied 

Well done

Hokkaido Teppanyaki Steakhouse is the answer to, "Where should I dine with children in Las Vegas?"¬†
Teppanyaki is a style of Japanese cuisine in which food is cooked directly in front of guests on a hot iron plate. We arrived at 5:00 PM at opening time. With two tired children, I hoped this would be an option perfect for a family meal time. Jason, our Teppanyaki Chef, was our answer to a delicious dinner and entertainment. He had is sense of humor as one tool, a smile and his array of teppanyaki utensils. The children were immediately engaged by knife skills, the dynamic preparation of vegetables, scallops, lobster tail, shrimp, steak for grilling, and a refined act of food presentation.  In addition, we selected yakisoba (fried noodles) and rice. The entire experience was enjoyable from cooking, plating and eating.

From the moment we arrived, the attention to service was considerate and efficient. Throughout the evening, the staff kept drinks full, plates cleared from the table, and children's hashi in hand. Overall, we felt a positive atmosphere.

I observed another family at an adjacent table, the chef ensured food allergies were observed. He was polite and carefully prepared the Foods with consideration of gluten free soy sauce and seafood like shrimp.

Wish list:
Use of organic ingredients including rice, meats, and soy sauce.

Check to see if there's a changing table in restroom.

The chefs are really fun and friendly. There's lots of silly jokes and knife tricks to keep you entertained. You also get a free salad and soup with your meal. 

They are very accommodating to people with shellfish allergies because they made my chicken and rice first before everyone else's. 

We come here about 3 times a year since it opened. Highly recommend it!

I was here in October for my friends birthday. Safe to say we had a blast! I believe his name was Ronnie (our cook) and he was hilarious! Kept us laughing as he cooked for us. Of coarse the birthday surprise to my friend was another highlight with what they brought out. I would recommend this place for a special occasion.

This was our second visit to Hokkaido.  Again, portions were exceptionally small (throw in a few extra vegetables.). Also, they charge an extra $2.95 for fried rice instead of steamed rice.  $1.00 might be reasonable.  Service was okay, waitress was not very friendly.  Scallops were cooked well.  Teppanyaki cook not as entertaining as those I have seen in the past.  If you have a 2/1, then it is a pretty good deal.
Fresh. Flavorful. Don't miss the sea bass! So good.

This quant place was recommended by two different co-workers who live locally in a suburb of Las Vegas called Summerlin.  It did not disappoint!  I was by myself on work travel so I sat at the sushi bar.  I quickly ordered 3 rolls and the chef said, "I hope you're hungry".  I then asked him if 3 was too many and he recommended I start with two.  He was right.  Their rolls were much larger than the Orlando, Fl rolls that I am used to.  In Orlando, rolls are usually 8-10 pieces.  His rolls were probably 12-15 pieces each.  They were fresh and delicious.  I ordered the 007 and the Salmon Lemon.  Both were very good.  What I liked the most was that they weren't your typical rolls, they were ones I hadn't had before.  If you're in Summerlin, give this place a try!

I have been here many times and always had good service/food. However tonight's service was horrible. The waiter brought us one water for a party of 3. He never picked up the dishes from the salad and miso soup. We actually had to stack them out of the way. He forgot a side of rice, and I tried to flag him down and ended up getting the female server who came and took care of us. He eventually returned and apologized, but disappeared again so I ended up flagging down the female server once again for our check. I can't stand paying top dollar for food and getting mediocre service. We wont be back.

This place was very delicious. I ordered Filet Mignon with shrimp and my husband ordered chicken and shrimp. We enjoyed our meals and the chef was creative and social. I absolutely love this place and its reasonable to for the type of meals that are available. We enjoyed the food and show. I look forward to dining here again. Thank you to the staff especially Tom our waiter. He was so nice and served with outstanding customer service! I hope to see you all soon.

Entire family enjoyed the Teppan experience.
Food good, service good, atmosphere good.
